title: UX: Unable to reuse existing connection (for clone or get)
body:
#### What is the problem?

I have a remote on a host that is already set to share connections (to work around a policy of not accepting SSH keys):

```
Host <hostpattern>
    ControlMaster auto
    ControlPath ~/.ssh/%r@%h:%p
    ControlPersist yes
```

If I use `git-annex` directly, I will reuse an existing connection. If I use `datalad get`, I get something like:

```
$ datalad get sourcedata 
Total:   0%|                                                                                                                      | 0.00/64.7G [00:00<?, ?B/s]Password: Password: Password: Password: Password: Password: Password: Password:
```

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

1) Install a dataset from a host that requires a password login.
2) Ensure that host is set to use `ControlPersist`
3) SSH into the host
4) `git annex get` some files - should reuse existing connection
5) `datalad get` other files - will not

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

0.12.2

<details>
<summary>datalad wtf</summary>


#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)

Yes.
